meanings.definition: Brighter or more radiant in appearance
meanings.sent1: The sunnier sky made the flowers look even more beautiful.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was even sunnier than usual today.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur seemed to glow, making it appear even sunnier than the sun itself.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled with a sunnier light, as if reflecting the joy of a thousand suns.
meanings.sent5: The room was bathed in a sunnier glow, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The beach in Florida is always sunnier than the one in Alaska.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the sunnier side of the house for her plants.
meanings.sent3: The sunnier weather made everyone want to go outside and play.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt sunnier as the rays of love enveloped him.
meanings.sent5: The sunnier days of summer brought a sense of freedom and joy to all.

meanings.sent1: Her outlook on life became sunnier after she started volunteering.
meanings.sent2: He had a sunnier disposition when surrounded by his friends.
meanings.sent3: Even the grumpy old man couldn't resist the sunnier mood of the children playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The sunnier attitude of the team lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The sunnier thoughts in her mind cleared away the clouds of doubt and worry.
